39349727.review:
Null Vector is a simple rogue-lite/twin stick shooter with an 80's retro look and feel to it

Pros:
-The retro vibe it gives off is really pleasant and suits the game perfectly. From the bright neon colours and polygonal look to its soundtrack gives off the 80's feel perfectly.
-Slightly challenging and pretty quick to finish, not offering all that much in terms of content but it has a great replay value to it in my experience
-The small rogue-lite elements such as upgrades and power-ups add a nice little touch to the game
-It's free

Cons:
-Slightly rage inducing at times due to my own error (and the obvious keyboard-mouse combo I used to play it)

Overall this is a solid little game, definitely worth your time
8/10

38747696.review:
Null Vector is a 80's arcade simulator where you try to move a little cube to different. It's like Asteroids got a makeover and it's so boring. You basically move around in a room shooting stuff. There is a number on each room telling you how many waves you must survive to get out. E.g. 3 = 3 waves of enemies. The enemies are odd shapes that will shoot at you with different abilities like exploding bombs or teleporting attacks but it's all about move around and dodging them while attacking.

Gameplay-wise, this is a controller game. You move your triangle with the left controller stick and aim-shoot with the right controller stick. Kill all enemies to complete a zone. You have lives and if you get hit an enemy, you lose a life. If you lose all your lives, it's game over. You can collect crystals and trade them in to heal any damage you receive and vice versa. You can also use the crystals to buy ships parts, upgrade ship parts, permanently weld them to the ship, find secret locations, etc.

Conclusion, skip this game. It's like Asteroids in a room with the ability to move and shoot. Sure there are walls and different enemies but the core of the game is moving around and avoiding objects. 

[h1][b]PROS[/b][/h1]
1. Simple to Understand
Move around and shoot. What else is new?

[h1][b]CONS[/b][/h1]
1. It's so Boring
So, so boring.

38695809.review: Oyun bedava olmasına rağmen para verip alınacak kadar güzel bir oyun.

38625480.review:
There is a very strong core game here and this games hits its 80s arcade theme pretty dead on, but I have a few small niggles with it (as the game is still being finalised these may become irrelevant).

There are a couple of fringe retro "features" that could be improved or trimmed without upsetting the 80s motif IMO.

1. the cryptic/impartial description of the ships' status. I want to know exactly what ship parts I already have, Why not just give this basic information?
2. a description of items would be nice. What do nanobots do, for example? Retro games generally had instruction manuals, as this doesn't it should pick up the shortfall with a little description (granted this is redundant for most items thus far).
3. the points system is obsolete. Noone has cared about points in games for the last 30+ years, if they ever did, and its not clear even how points are gained. The game should be more clear about user performance, giving the user a clearer idea of what they can improve. I know that contradicts the arcade motif, but in my opinion in recreations of older products,  one should ideally extract only whats good, and be mindful of sensible modern improvements. This may make for a marginally less authentic product, but a higher quality one.

Finally, this feels like a game targetting a hardcore audience, but isn't really that difficult. I hadn't even mastered the controls (I was constantly getting my wires crossed between moving the ship and shooting, and mostly only kept to 4 directions instead of 8), and still beat the game quite comfortably, just by upgrading the right way (basically stacking up attacks and slaughtering everything on screen).

Obviously game length is not a current strong point, though with permadeath there is an inherent soft limit.

Finally controller support is a must.

36637893.review:
(Disclaimer: Typed this on November 20th, 2017, so around three weeks after Update #2.)

"What if the contestant from Smash TV hijacked the ship from Asteroids and crashed it into an retro arcade game that stole some of the excess neon from Farcry Blood Dragon?"

That's pretty much Null Vector in a nutshell. A very much retro-styled twinstick shooter in which your ship and weapon can be upgraded with various stacking power-ups. Like in many retro games, the task you're given is simple: survive six randomly generated floors and, if you get far enough, fight against the boss at the end. Or go down in a blaze of glory.

Even in its relatively barebones and early access state (which, at the moment is currently at the crazy price of nothing!), Null Vector does precisely what the blurb on the Steam store page says it does; give you a rogue-lite experience that, reminiscent of the arcades, lends itself quite nicely to being one of those "pick up and play" experiences that you can play in short bursts without having to tax yourself. 

Other than dodging bullets (and the enemies firing them!), there isn't too much focus needed. And, sometimes, that's what you want in a gaming experience. Don't feel up to shaving down your lap times in a sim-racer or countering the opposing team's strategies in an FPS? That's what twinsticks are for. Blast little polygonal enemies into bits: The Game.

Sure, right now, I've got a shade over two hours of accumulated game time but, in those a hundred and twenty-odd minutes, I must've chalked up a dozen attempts and only managed to kill the boss once. If you make it that far, it really doesn't take that long to get to the end; a really condensed and fun experience, if that's what you're into.

One last thing: Is there any better weapon combo than Piercing Ricochet Rockets? :P

36596990.review: A fun little rogue-lite shaping up to be a solid game. There's a lot of potential here, and if you enjoy the genre, this is a nice distraction. Still a bit bare bones, but for a f2p early access game, easily worth the download.

36594092.review:
Writing a review because I enjoyed this game a lot. GET IT NOW AND PLAY IT!

Pros:
-can customize your ship to match your playstyle (some upgrades better than others imo)
-difficult but very satisfying to play 
-music is bomb + retro arcade style creates such a cool vibe

The game is fairly short but not easy; it's addicting and keeps you coming back. All the combinations for your ship, the music, and the experience of dodging bullets and emerging victorious are exciting! It's fun trying out different equips for your ship imo.. had 4 bots with me at one point and hid behind a wall as they took care of some waves haha.

Some things I noticed that may help you:
-rockets seem to be easier to use than lasers in my experience. You need to be more precise with lasers because they shoot instantaneously and are thin, while rockets have that slight traveling distance and what feels like a bigger hit box. 
-do not get multi shot with lasers if you suck at the above^ IT'S WORSE.
-upgrading damage also increases your weapon size (bigger rockets/bigger lasers)
-there seems to be a cap/limit on fire rate at a certain point ? (equipping two slots of fire rate) not sure but there probably is one for all enhancements. 
-It's one or the other with lasers/rockets. Be careful on what you permanently keep because you can't change it afterwards.
-lasers + ricochet? not such a good idea unless you're good at aiming at angles. Lasers + ricochet + multi shot is better.
-if using the keyboard to play, you can not only move diagonally (holding down two buttons simultaneously) but can also shoot diagonally (same thing)

My tips on beating the boss:
-rockets
-HIGH fire rate
-damage/pierce

My first failed attempt was with lasers, ricochet, and multi shot (possibly also high-ish fire rate). Other than that epic disco look and the feel of firing a laser, Lasers < Rocket imo. I had some laser and rocket bots with me, which was helpful but unecessary. Shields are always great. Got those for safety so I could take some hits and still win, but if you're good at dodging shots, it's not necessary. The times I won were when I had those listed above and ricochet, which was DEVASTATING. Wiped the boss pretty easily. Ricochet is awesome, but I think what's key are those above.

Oops, long review. TL;DR GET THE GAME! 
Have fun and good luck!

35522773.review: 非常有趣的一款射击小游戏。不同的加成道具效果可以叠加，这个设计非常有趣。传统的射击游戏一般广范围攻击和激光以及普通导弹都是互相排斥的取代型道具，但是在这个游戏里居然融合到了一起。加上激光之后，普通攻击变成激光。加上反射之后，激光也有了反射效果，加上追踪弹之后，激光也可以自动瞄准，加上导弹，激光也拥有了炸裂伤害……最终神装：激光，散射，导弹，反射，追踪，再加几个护盾或者小随从……

35502877.review:
An accessible free-to-play arcade title that leaves much to be had but is nonetheless fun at its core.

For the sake of the dreaded game comparisons, if you combine the aesthetics of the retro-arcade-favorite Tempest with a Geometry Wars that’s taken some time off its steroids, you get Null Vector. 

Late 80’s-inspired visuals and rock synth create the atmospheric vibe of a day at the arcade clad with tucked-in shirts, rimmed glasses and sweaty determination. In Null Vector, you traverse procedurally generated, grid-layered rooms fighting off opposing geometries. 

While gliding across these random battles, the triangular protagonist can apply various, yet limited upgrades to its ship – often coming across wielding stations that permanently attach these improvements, allocating space for newer items.

At face value, the game’s fast-paced, reactive environment makes for a re-playable title; dying just short of completing a floor when you’ve completely upgraded your ship fuels motivation to beat the game in one fell swoop. 

However, this is also part of a larger problem: the game is too damn short now. Other than its difficulty, there’s a lacking incentive to replay the game once you’ve beaten it. 

Though, this shortcoming shouldn’t be rapped on too much; what is clearly a F2P title has much room to grow and expand its level. Overall, I’d give it a go for the sake of lost nostalgia for the stellar 80’s atmosphere.

35382065.review:
Null Vector is a callback to older, simpler times in Video Games. With a visual style reminiscent of Tron and gameplay similar to Asteroids, it definitely succeeds. When you first enter Null Vector's world, you will be welcomed with an arcade machine, reminding you that it's all a game. But when you begin playing, you get absorbed by your desire to succeed.

The mechanics of Null Vector are finely tuned to allow tight control over the player-character, leaving each consecutive defeat at the fault of the player alone. But unlike other rogue-likes, you can return to your point of death quickly as you get better with each run. Eventually you find yourself cruising through rooms with little-to-no damage each time, and then become faced with an even bigger challenge.

The boss really ties everything together. The first time you encounter it, you will likely die. The second time, you will die again. This addendum forces you to think about every hit you take and every item you grab. Are you being efficient enough? Will you have enough potential to defeat the boss? How much room for error can you have? Without the boss, this element would be completely missed.

10/10 - Excellent craftsmanship and execution

35373965.review:
I've tried this game for a few minutes, just long enough to beat the boss, so here are my impressions:

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Simple yet fun mechanics
    [*]Nicely crafted graphics and effects
    [*]Solid music
    [*]Nice variety of enemies, further improved by the randomization of every single room
    [*]Great '80s feeling
    [*]Many different modifications to fit all playstyles.
[/list]
[h1]Cons / fields that still need improvements:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]There is still room for a lot more of enemies and modifications
    [*]Some modifications are rather weak/useless, to the point I'd just avoid them completely
    [*]Sometimes the randomization causes too many enemies/too few crystals to spawn, making the run harder than it is supposed to be at the very beginning.
[/list]

Overall, I really like this game. I was searching for some "free today" games to add to my library and stumbled upon it, I really don't regret doing so. After playing it for a while I can say I'd gladly like to pay for it.

35158864.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Null Vector is a free retro-style action game in which you have to destroy all of the enemy ships to advance to the next levels. Sounds simple right? Wrong. Null Vector is harder than you might think (or else I suck more than I'll admit) and you may find it a bit challenging to clear the room you're in (even though the first room is super easy).

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]I love the [b]exploration[/b] in this game. Simple, yet effective, after each room you will often have multiple paths to follow. There is more than one room type and multiple ways to get to the next room you need to go to in order to advance.
[*][b]Variety of enemies[/b] is something this game does really well. Between the guys shooting at you, the diamonds that bounce around, until destroyed when they explode into multiple projectiles, the squares that shoot mines, the drills that try to ram you, and even more types you'll find you have a lot to handle.
[*]There is a lot of [b]customization options[/b] for your ship and it really lets you choose the upgrades you want. I won't fully go into how this works, so you can see it for yourself, but you start off with three ship part slots and will come across parts as you play. These are random so counterbalnced to the power of customization you get is the fact that you have to make do with what you get. I myself do not like, for example, ricochet or laser as much as the helper bots, shield, or damage/fire rate boosts, but when ricochet or laser are the only choices you have you have to pick one. This also forces you to adapt to the particular situation. This system is more complex then what I've described but, like I say, I'll let you see for yourself.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]I dunno..., the fact that I can't buy the sountrack I guess...?
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
I could have mabye listed other things in the pros but I think what I wrote will suffice. The game has really cool 80's design. The levels are well laid out. It's simple but the postion of the obstacles will chance the room significatly. Since this game is free and so well designed, there is no reason not to pick it up. Also, as it is (currently) in early access I assume we can except some imporvements (not that I can imagine what could be improved anyhow).

35120288.review: Definitely recommend this game! The ability to combine weapon properties is a huge draw, and what makes me willing to run through the small set of randomized levels over and over. Some of the properties have some odd balancing choices - damage and homing slow your fire rate, which makes sense, yet nabbing multishot and fire rate can enable you to spray the entire game field with fire, annihilating things quickly - assuming you're fortunate enough to get that combination. Considering the game is FREE, it's worth checking out, and I'm definitely going to buy it when it becomes an option. Even more, the developer is updating the game - the most recent patch added a bunch of important features & more content, so it seems likely that this will be the game that scratches my "i'll just play one more quick game, before I go to bed" itch for the foreseeable future.

34858350.review:
シンプルで分かりやすく何度でも気軽にやり直せるので色々試行錯誤などしたりできる。
自機の強化パーツが多く存在し、クリスタル（Ｃ）をやりくりして次の部屋に自分の戦闘スタイルで挑みましょう。
ＢＧＭもカッコよく撃破時の画面の揺れや聞き心地の良いＳＥでＰＶＰで疲れた時の癒しにもなるかも？
ダウンロードは自分のパソコンで2分で終わったので無料だしやってみるのをおすすめします。
今後のボス増加や強化パーツ増加に期待。

アップデートにより、パーツの追加や調整、セクターが１つ追加されました。ローカルCO-OPもできるようになって一人ゲーの域を超えました。このままオンラインとかなったら完全にAC感がなくなりますが、気にしなければ今後に十分に期待のできる将来有望なゲームだと思うます。

34844093.review:
I have been playing the game with the arrow keys, and, while it is a little painful, it is fantastic so far! Cool♥♥♥♥♥vector style graphics, one of the best soundtracks I've ever heard, and a smooth combat experience! I also love the smooth transitions between rooms! Overall, it is fantastic, and the only thing holding it back, is the controls. However, I have heard that an upcoming patch will fix the controls. Cannot wait to see what else the developer has in store in the future! Most developers would have made the current state of the game the completed version, then sold it for $10. However, not only is this game free, it is in early access, so much more content is to come!
Overall: 7.5/10


PS: I voted this game for the 2017 Steam Awards. I'm excited to see if it wins!

34830145.review: Sci Fi shooter meets dungeon crawler.  Very fun game.  Can't wait for the full version!  The difficulty is just right.  Once you get more levels and upgrades I am sure the replayability will sky rocket.  I love games like Binding of Isaac and this is a great little twist on the dungeon crawler genre.  Plays perfectly on my piece of crap PC.  Would highly recommend.

34768074.review:
If [i]The Binding of Isaac[/i] met an 80's arcade twin-stick shooter, [i]Null Vector[/i] is what comes from the honeymoon.

A bullet hell-esque rogue-lite with nostalgic aesthetics that'll hit you hard if you remember those days at the arcade, [i]Null Vector[/i] will occupy your time for quite a while with its randomly generated levels and highly customizable ship upgrade system. Its soundtrack is also pretty rockin' with synths anywhere and everywhere.

You don't know happiness until you've got multishot lasers that ricochet [i]and[/i] home in on targets.

34741051.review:
I found Null Vector on the early access portion of Steam and of course I'm going to download it -- it's also free.

I just really like the actual look to it (and the soundtrack is banging). 

Basically the gameplay loop that I've found so far delving into this is very Binding of Isaac/Zelda like where you're advancing through a dungeon via windows but each door has a variable on it (say like 1,2,3 or {T}) the numbers represent how many waves their are and the {T} is the store.

As you progress you'll find stations where you can weld an item that you pickup (example more damage, lazers, etc.) which allows another upgrade (you max at 3 but can exceed it with this mechanic)

I haven't ran into an actual boss yet, but it gets hard. Like bullet hell hard. It's like this blend of a roguelike and bullet hell that I really adore and plan to play more of and have seen like 0 coverage on this game.

Gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=23N3FDVahVI

34727860.review:
It's free. 

Not only is it free, it's fun! A quick play game that will take you at most 30 minutes to finish, then hey, hop right back in. It's a basic twin stick shooter with some light leveling up (finding power ups or permanently attaching power ups to make more room for other toys). Move room to room, fight enemies, repeat.

Other pros: Great sound track, nifty sounds in general and a pretty rad outrun style to the graphics.

34720580.review: Awesome game. Its clearly inspired by binding of isaac, but instead of gross babies and poop, you have vector graphics and bullet hell light. 34711969.review:
I really liked this game, although right now it doesn't have much of replayability or content to offer. The experience was enjoyable and I would definetely play more when and if there's more levels to play.

+Has retro feeling to it but game feels original
+Wide variety of ways to modify your projectiles to fit your style
+Enemies behave differently (not just reskin with more health/damage)
+Simple controls

-No difficulty levels (Difficulty felt just right to me, but I'm sure there are people who would desire harder or easier game)
-Very short game (5 levels + boss fight)(Early access)
-No much replayability (Early access)

34707051.review:
This is a fun little early-access game that shows great promise.

Pros:

> Simple control scheme (Does exactly what it needs to do)
> New layout changes every time (but once you've played trough it once you've seen it all)
> Nice aesthetic
> (Bit of a personal one) I like the fact that the title on the arcade machine is in the Iron Maiden font

Could be improved:

> Enemy variety (you've basically just got chargers, single-shot, quick-shot and spreadshot)
> Upgrade variety
> Length (depends how long you want to enjoy the game for, but all the sectors are short and there are only 5/6 of them)

Overall a good game. Would recommend it to anyone that wants a free, enjoyable rogue-like experience.

34673542.review:
Un jeu très sympa, du moins lors de la première prise en main!

Niveau gameplay, vous y retrouverez de nombreux échos : des niveaux comme les donjons de The Legend of Zelda, où chaque salle annonce la couleur, une maniabilité qui s'apparente également à du Isaac, mêlant shoot et esquive et un petit système d'upgrade qui se "stack" qui semble permettre de bien booster son petit vaisseau.

Mais ce qui rend ce jeu intéressant, c'est ce tout mélangé dans une bonne ambiance "virtuel des années 80", avec ses couleurs néons et sa bande sonore qui pulse bien! Question de goût, bien sûr, mais pour ceux qui aiment ce genre d'esthétique (et les jeux rogue-like/shooter) le jeu fera mouche.

Dès les premiers niveaux, on a droit à un petit panel d'upgrades et d'ennemis possibles, ce qui présage de bonnes choses quant à l'envie varier les expériences niveau gameplay. Keep it up, Null Vector, tu es sur la bonne voie!

39880936.review:
Нулевой Вектор - довольно годный, неоново-минималистичный рогалик.

[u]Внимание: обзор пишется пока игра в раннем доступе, и все нижеизложенное, актуально на дату публикации.[/u]

По пунктам, игра выглядит так:
[list]
    [*]У нас есть 7 уровней (7-ой с боссом), с n-м количеством рандомно генерируемых комнат, в которых нам надо победить врагов, найти апгрейды (урон (damage), пробивание (piercing) и ракетный бот (rocket bot), самые полезные), и получить максимальный счет.

    [*]Бои в игре хардкорные, динамичные и веселые. Несмотря на рекомендацию игры с геймпадом, на клавиатуре управление вполне отзывчивое.

    [*]Есть модификаторы, открывающиеся при определенных условиях. Они усложняют игру, но увеличивают очки.

    [*]При наличии геймпада можно играть вдвоем с другом, что увеличивает уровень кайфа от игры.

    [*]Графика неоновая, минималистичная, но приятная. Музыка в целом приличная.

    [*]Из бесполезного: в игре есть автоматы которые за кристаллы удаляют апгрейды. Смысла в этом мало, ибо апгрейды можно тупо выбросить. По идее от этого тратиться здоровье, но его можно подобрать, а вот кристаллы нужны всегда. Радар, за кристаллы показывающий где есть автоматы, тоже малополезен, лучше бы он выход показывал, ибо пока будем его искать, найдем и почти все автоматы. Очки в игре есть, а глобального рейтинга нет, это печаль.

    [*]Из минусов - босс всегда один и тот же, хотелось бы большего разнообразия. То же и с уровнями, через час они уже надоедают.
[/list]

Как итог: довольно хороший рогалик на 20-30 минут прохождения. Открыть все модификаторы, и пройти игру раз 5, вполне можно часа за 1.5-2. Любителям жанра, сыграть можно.
8 НЛО из 10
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1126011506

[i]P.s: если этот обзор был для Вас полезен ставьте лайк, а также добавляйтесь в друзья и подписывайтесь на меня как куратора - [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28776273/] Обзоры онлайн [/url][/i]

39824204.review:
For a guy who just was browsing steam randomly and came across another review saying how this was a good game, I said "why the hell not" and downloaded it.

This honestly is a game you should at least give a few minutes of your time to at the least. It's a great arcade shooter with very dynamic gameplay and building your arsenal of items from shooting lasers, having little rocket bots and guarding your terrible mistakes with a shield just adds to the fun of this game. The gameplay in my eyes doesn't get repetitive due to the fact that the stages are randomized, your tools and weapons you come across are jumbled about and you even have to choose between perks and weapons to build a powerful arsenal that is tailored to your tastes.

 Null Vector is a great experience to partake in. I highly recommend this game if you just want a game to mess around in, Challenge yourself or just burn some of your time.

[spoiler]The Laser II, Shield II and Ricochet are the best perks. No contest >:)[/spoiler]
